Definition: PUDL plant id. Allows some linkage between FERC & EIA Data.
EIA Plant Identification number. One to five digit numeric.
Name of entity which operates the plant; from EIA923 records.
US state in which the plant is located.
Year for which the data was reported.
PUDL utility id. Allows some linkage between FERC & EIA Data.
Name of the power plant as reported to FERC.
Total installed capacity. Maximum generation nameplate rating in MW.
Net peak demand on plant in MW.
Net continuous plant capacity when limited by condenser water in MW.
Net continuous plant capacity when not limited by condenser water in MW.
Net generation exclusive of plant use in MWh.
Maintenance of miscellaneous steam (or nuclear) plant.
If correlation of an expns field with net_generation_mwh is >0.5 then that expense field is considered a "production" cost. (see ‘Expense Correlations’ tab for values)
Total of all non-fuel expns_ fields having >= 0.5 correlation with net_generation_mwh across the entire dataset.
Total of all expns_ fields that having < 0.5 correlation with net_generation_mwh.
